roleset.name: cause to see
roleset.note: SHOW-V NOTES: Based on big corpus, comparison with 'see. 'Member of Vncls conjecture-29.5-2, transfer_mesg-37.1.1-1-1, crane-40.3.2, indicate-78-1-1, reflexive_appearance-48.1.2. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from show.01-v)
SHOW-N NOTES: Roleset based on show.01. Verbnet class conjecture 29.5. Framed by Katie. (from show.02-n)
SHOWING-N NOTES: Roleset based on noun entry show.01; corresponds to Verbnet class conjecture 29.5. Framed by Claire. (from showing.01-n)

example.name: seer as NP
example.text: Can you show me evening flights from Nashville to Houston that serve dinner?
example.arg: evening flights from Nashville to Houston that serve dinner

example.name: with WH-clause
example.text: The case showed how testing was being overused.

example.name: Example with arg 1 (but not arg 0, because of 'snaps')
example.text: "We 're not running that ad campaign any more," Mr.Straszheim snaps in a rare show of irritation .

example.name: Example with both args
example.text: John's show of strength was more than impressive

example.name: within LVC
example.text: According to department policy , prosecutors must make a strong showing that lawyers ' fees came from assets tainted by illegal profits before any attempts at seizure are made .
example.arg: that lawyers ' fees came from assets tainted by illegal profits
before any attempts at seizure are made .

roleset.name: show/production
roleset.note: SHOW-N NOTES: Roleset based on broadcast.01. No corresponding VN class. Framed by Katie. (from show.01-n)

role.descr: Type of show, title, or message

example.name: Example of arg 0 as a country of creation
Arg 3 when its not TV
example.text: Broadway's new Andrew Lloyd Webber show

example.name: Arg 1 as a title
example.text: The TV show Mike and Buffy

roleset.name: appear
roleset.note: SHOW_UP-V NOTES: Member of Vncls appear-48.1.1. (from show.02-v)

roleset.name: display something (often oneself) proudly
roleset.note: SHOW_OFF-V NOTES: Predicate added by Arrick. Member of VNcls reflexive_appearance-48.1.2. (from show.03-v)
SHOWING_OFF-N NOTES: Based on ontonotes nouns. Comparison to show.03-v. Show.03 is a member of VN class reflexive_appearance-48.1.2.Framed by Katie. (from showing.02-n)

example.text: because [Treasury Secretary Snow]-1 took a group of reporters to a trip to Afghanistan and other parts of the world *PRO*-1 to show off how they were tracking terror financing.
example.arg: how they were tracking terror financing

example.name: all args
example.text: John's showing off of his "skills" to Mary was pathetic
